candidates.title: Was Kirk Cameron Diagnosed With a Rare Form of Leprosy?
candidates.content:
Claim:
Actor Kirk Cameron has contracted an extremely rare form of leprosy.
On 26 July 2017, TheLastLineOfDefense.com published a shocking article about an unexpected diagnosis for former child actor Kirk Cameron:
Actor, musician, director and devoted follower of Christ, Kirk Cameron, has been stricken with an extremely rare form of what can only be described as a biblical disease. Cameron has a mutated form of leprosy that is so rare, less than one in 600 million people will ever encounter someone who has it.
The strain, leprosis metapupalis carnivore, essentially turns its victim into a walking pile of dead skin, rotting flesh, and festering organs while keeping the brain functioning at primal levels and the heart pumping just enough to send diseased blood to the marrow and muscles to allow the person to be mobile.
This is not a genuine news item. TheLastLineOfDefense.com is an entertainment web site that does not publish factual stories, and carries multiple disclaimers labeling its content as fiction:
In a cynical world where the news of the day often seems fake, The Last Line of Defense offers today's busy conservative a place to go to read things they'll enjoy and congregate with a bunch of people they agree with. So while everything on this site is a satirical work of fiction, we are proud to present it to those who will have called it real anyway.
DISCLAIMER: Americas Last Line of Defense is a satirical publication that may sometimes appear to be telling the truth. We assure you thats not the case. We present fiction as fact and our sources dont actually exist. Names that represent actual people and places are purely coincidental and all images should be considered altered and do not in any way depict reality.
In other words, if you believe this crap youre a real dumbass.
candidates.description: A shocking report about the former child actor was just another hoax from a well-known purveyor of satire.

result.explanation: The news caption is directly quoted from a satirical website, TheLastLineOfDefense.com, as noted in the provided evidence from Snopes.  Snopes explicitly states that the website's content is fictional and not factual. Therefore, the caption is false.
result.supporting_points: Source 1: TheLastLineOfDefense.com is identified as a satirical website. The news caption is quoted as coming from this source, but this website explicitly labels its content as fiction and not fact.  Snopes confirms this, stating the claim is a hoax.

final_result.explanation: The internal consistency check finds some alignment between the image and caption. The image depicts Kirk Cameron speaking, which is consistent with his roles as an actor, musician, director, and public figure. However, the claim about him having a "biblical disease" is not visually evident in the image. The external check definitively refutes the caption's claim.  The claim originates from a satirical website, a fact confirmed by Snopes.  This confirms that the caption is fabricated and not a factual representation of Kirk Cameron's health status. The high confidence score from the external check (10) outweighs the moderate confidence score from the internal check (10). The discrepancy arises because the internal check only assesses the image's visual content against the caption's description of Kirk Cameron's professions and public persona, while the external check focuses on the veracity of the caption's central claim regarding a "biblical disease."  The external evidence, which establishes the caption's origin in satire and its falsity, supersedes the partial internal consistency. Therefore, the caption is deemed out of context because its central assertion is demonstrably false, despite some superficial alignment with the image's content.
final_result.validation_summary: Internal check shows partial alignment, while external check strongly refutes the caption's core claim, identifying it as originating from a satirical website. The external evidence decisively outweighs the internal assessment, leading to a conclusion of the caption being out of context.
